page.title: 07COMMUNICATIONS at Blindcrake
page.content: Being a small village most people know each other so "word of mouth" is the favourite medium of communication. In the centre of the village is The Notice Board, read by most each day as they collect their newspaper from the box underneath where they were left after delivery from Cockermouth. The monthly Church Magazine is taken by almost everyone and the Chapel also has a notice board. Travelling shops, almost one a day, and the Library Bus also provide a focal point. There is a public phone in the village but most homes have their own. Postal delivery is once a day and collection from the one box twice a day (Sundays excepted). Television reception can be poor due to local hills so most houses have, unfortunately, large aerials.
